details.summary: The British Embassy in Yerevan works to develop and sustain bilateral relations between the UK and Armenia. We deal with political, human rights, cultural and economic questions of interest to the UK and Armenia.
details.description: We work to improve human rights and good governance, and support various projects to improve this areas. We work closely with the Department of Defence Policy to maintain relations between the UK and Armenia on defence matters. We support UK trade and economy, and develop stronger ties with Armenian commercial sectors.
details.services:
Travel advice

Information, news and updates, listed country by country, to ensure you stay safe, avoid problems, and make informed decisions when living or travelling abroad.

Passports and emergency travel documents

How to renew or replace your British passport if you live outside the UK and information on getting replacement travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Visas

Information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply.

Summer is one of the busiest times of the year for applications, and this year is no exception - our appointment schedule is fully booked until 03 July. The visa section would like to remind any applicants of the importance of making an appointment to place their paperwork at the section at least 15 working days in advance of travel ie. if intending to travel on 01 August, an applicant should attend an appointment on 11 July. Please visit our website on http://www.ukba.homeoffice.gov.uk/ and/or www.gov.uk/world/armenia for information on the application process, rules and guidance pertaining to an application and paperwork required. Failure to prepare in advance could mean that your application is not successful and you therefore miss your opportunity to travel.

Births, deaths and marriages

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas, and legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.
